title: [Epic] libmarmot: Pure C implementation of the Marmot protocol
description:
Implement the Marmot protocol (MIP-00 through MIP-04) as a pure C library (libmarmot) with a focused MLS implementation for ciphersuite 0x0001. The library uses libsodium + OpenSSL for crypto, libnostr for Nostr events, NIP-44 for encryption, NIP-59 for gift-wrapping, and libgo for async operations.

The scaffold (headers, types, error codes, storage vtable, in-memory backend, MLS crypto primitives, TLS codec, extension serialization) is already complete. Remaining work covers: MLS protocol layers (TreeKEM, key schedule, framing, group operations), Marmot protocol integration (MIP-00 through MIP-03), SQLite storage backend, MDK interop tests, marmot-gobject GObject wrapper, and build system finalization.

Dependencies: libnostr, NIP-44, NIP-59, libgo, libsodium, OpenSSL, SQLite3.
Target: byte-for-byte interoperability with MDK (Rust reference implementation).

Directory: libmarmot/ (pure C) + marmot-gobject/ (GObject wrapper)

title: [Epic] Phase 1: MLS Foundation — TreeKEM, Key Schedule, Framing
description:
Implement the core MLS protocol primitives for ciphersuite 0x0001 (MLS_128_DHKEMX25519_AES128GCM_SHA256_Ed25519). These are the building blocks for all group operations.

Builds on the already-completed scaffold: mls_crypto.c (HPKE, HKDF, AEAD, signing) and mls_tls.c (TLS serialization).

Deliverables:
1. TreeKEM ratchet tree operations (mls_tree.c)
2. Key schedule derivation (mls_key_schedule.c)
3. Message framing — PrivateMessage, PublicMessage, content types (mls_framing.c)
4. All validated against RFC 9420 test vectors

title: Implement MLS TreeKEM ratchet tree (mls_tree.c)
description:
Implement the left-balanced binary tree used by MLS for key agreement (TreeKEM, RFC 9420 §7).

Required operations:
- Tree node addressing (left, right, parent, sibling, root, copath, direct path)
- Leaf node / parent node creation and manipulation
- Node resolution (finding non-blank nodes for encryption)
- Blank node handling (removed members → blank)
- Path secret encryption: encrypt path secrets to copath resolution using HPKE
- Path secret decryption: decrypt received path secrets
- Tree hash computation (§7.8) for transcript integrity
- Parent hash computation (§7.9) for path validation
- Tree filtering for external tree representation

Only support ciphersuite 0x0001 (X25519 + AES-128-GCM + SHA-256 + Ed25519).

Validation: Test with 2, 4, 8, 16, and 32 member trees. Verify tree hash determinism.
Reference: mdk/src/lib.rs, RFC 9420 §7.

title: Implement MLS key schedule (mls_key_schedule.c)
description:
Implement the MLS key schedule (RFC 9420 §8) for deriving per-epoch and per-message keys.

Required derivations:
- init_secret → joiner_secret → epoch_secret chain
- From epoch_secret derive: sender_data_secret, encryption_secret, exporter_secret, external_secret, confirmation_key, membership_key, resumption_psk, epoch_authenticator
- Sender ratchet: per-sender key derivation for application messages (generation counter)
- Receiver key lookup by sender leaf index + generation
- Secret tree initialization and traversal
- welcome_secret derivation for Welcome messages
- Exporter secret derivation (critical for MIP-03 NIP-44 conversation keys)

Use HKDF-Expand-Label (already implemented in mls_crypto.c) for all derivations.

Validation: RFC 9420 Appendix D key schedule test vectors.
Reference: mdk/src/lib.rs key schedule, RFC 9420 §8.

title: Implement MLS message framing (mls_framing.c)
description:
Implement MLS message framing (RFC 9420 §6) for encoding/decoding MLS messages.

Required types:
- MLSMessage: top-level container (version, cipher_suite, wire_format, body)
- PublicMessage: signed plaintext (for proposals/commits in Marmot)
- PrivateMessage: encrypted (for application messages)
- FramedContent: content_type dispatch (application, proposal, commit)
- FramedContentTBS: signing input serialization
- SenderData encryption/decryption (AES-128-GCM with sender_data_secret)
- Content authentication (MAC computation for confirmation)
- Wire format negotiation

Must correctly serialize/deserialize all framing types using the TLS codec (mls_tls.c).

Validation: Round-trip tests + MDK interop vectors.
Reference: RFC 9420 §6.

title: [Epic] Phase 2: MLS Group Operations — KeyPackage, Group, Welcome
description:
Implement the MLS group lifecycle operations: KeyPackage creation/validation, group creation, member addition via Welcome, commit processing, and group state transitions.

Builds on Phase 1 (TreeKEM, key schedule, framing).

Deliverables:
1. KeyPackage creation, signing, validation, KeyPackageRef computation (mls_key_package.c)
2. MLS group state machine — create, add members, remove members, update, epoch transitions (mls_group.c)
3. Welcome message construction and processing (mls_welcome.c)
4. Commit creation and processing with proposal bundling
5. All validated against MDK interop vectors

title: Implement MLS KeyPackage creation and validation (mls_key_package.c)
description:
Implement KeyPackage structs per RFC 9420 §10.

Operations:
- Generate HPKE init_key pair (X25519)
- Generate Ed25519 signing key pair (leaf credential)
- Set BasicCredential with Nostr pubkey identity
- Set capabilities (ciphersuite 0x0001 only)
- Set extensions (lifetime, Marmot-specific)
- Sign KeyPackage with leaf private key
- Compute KeyPackageRef = RefHash(serialized_key_package) — already in mls_crypto.c
- Validate incoming KeyPackages (verify signature, check capabilities, verify lifetime)
- TLS serialization/deserialization of KeyPackage struct

The KeyPackageRef is critical — it's used as the identifier in MIP-00 kind:443 events.

Reference: mdk/src/key_package.rs, RFC 9420 §10.

title: Implement MLS group state machine (mls_group.c)
description:
Implement the MLS group state machine per RFC 9420 §11-12.

Operations:
- Create new group: initialize tree with single leaf, set group_id, epoch=0, derive initial key schedule
- Add member: create Add proposal, create Commit bundling the proposal, encrypt path secrets
- Remove member: create Remove proposal + Commit, blank removed leaf
- Self-update: create Update proposal + Commit, rotate own leaf key pair
- Process incoming Commit: validate proposals, update tree, advance epoch
- Process incoming Proposal: queue for later Commit
- Pending commit tracking: handle the 'pending commit' pattern from MDK (creator can't decrypt until they receive their own commit back)
- Epoch snapshot/rollback for commit race resolution
- Group extensions management (add/update the Marmot GroupData extension)

The group must track: current epoch, tree, key schedule, transcript hash, confirmed/interim transcript hash, group context.

Reference: mdk/src/lib.rs (Mdk::create_group, process_message, merge_pending_commit), RFC 9420 §11-12.

title: Implement MLS Welcome message construction and processing (mls_welcome.c)
description:
Implement Welcome message creation and processing per RFC 9420 §12.4.3.

Creation (by group admin adding a new member):
- Encrypt GroupInfo with welcome_secret derived from key schedule
- Create GroupSecrets (joiner_secret + path_secret for the new member's position)
- Encrypt GroupSecrets to new member's init_key from their KeyPackage (HPKE Seal)
- Bundle encrypted GroupSecrets + encrypted GroupInfo into Welcome struct
- TLS-serialize the Welcome struct

Processing (by joining member):
- Find own EncryptedGroupSecrets entry by KeyPackageRef match
- Decrypt GroupSecrets using own init_key private key (HPKE Open)
- Decrypt GroupInfo using welcome_secret
- Reconstruct ratchet tree from GroupInfo + path_secret
- Initialize key schedule at the group's current epoch
- Verify group state integrity (tree hash, etc.)

Reference: mdk/src/welcome.rs, RFC 9420 §12.4.3.

title: Implement MLS application message encrypt/decrypt
description:
Implement application message encryption and decryption using the MLS framing layer.

Encrypt (sender):
- Look up sender's leaf index in the tree
- Derive message key + nonce from sender ratchet (key schedule) at current generation
- Encrypt FramedContent as PrivateMessage (AES-128-GCM)
- Encrypt SenderData (leaf index + generation) with sender_data_secret
- Advance sender ratchet generation
- Serialize as MLSMessage

Decrypt (receiver):
- Decrypt SenderData to recover leaf index + generation
- Look up sender's ratchet, derive key + nonce for that generation
- Decrypt PrivateMessage content
- Verify content authentication
- Return decrypted FramedContent

Handle out-of-order delivery: tolerate generation gaps up to config.out_of_order_tolerance.

Reference: mdk/src/lib.rs (encrypt_message, process_message for application type), RFC 9420 §15.

title: MLS group operations integration tests
description:
Create comprehensive tests for the MLS group operations layer.

Tests:
- Create 2-member group: Alice creates, adds Bob via Welcome
- Bob processes Welcome, joins group
- Alice sends application message, Bob decrypts
- Bob sends application message, Alice decrypts
- Add 3rd member (Charlie): commit + welcome
- Remove member: remove Bob, verify Bob can't decrypt new messages
- Self-update: Alice rotates keys, Bob processes commit
- Epoch transition verification: keys change after commit
- Pending commit: creator can't decrypt until merge_pending_commit
- Out-of-order message tolerance
- Commit race: two members commit simultaneously, rollback/retry
- Large group (10+ members): add all, send messages, verify all decrypt

File: libmarmot/tests/test_mls_group.c

title: [Epic] Phase 3: Marmot Protocol Layer — MIP-00 through MIP-03
description:
Implement the Marmot-specific protocol layer on top of the MLS primitives. This bridges MLS operations to Nostr events (kind:443, 444, 445) using libnostr, NIP-44, and NIP-59.

Builds on Phase 2 (MLS group operations).

Deliverables:
1. MIP-00: Credentials & KeyPackages — create/parse kind:443 events
2. MIP-01: Group construction — create groups with Marmot GroupData extension, admin policies
3. MIP-02: Welcome events — gift-wrap welcomes as kind:444 events via NIP-59
4. MIP-03: Group messages — encrypt/decrypt kind:445 events with NIP-44 using MLS exporter secrets
5. Full wire-compatible with MDK

title: MIP-00: Implement Credentials & KeyPackages (kind:443)
description:
Implement MIP-00 — linking Nostr identity to MLS credentials.

Operations:
- create_key_package(): Generate MLS KeyPackage with Nostr pubkey as BasicCredential identity, set relay URL extensions, sign with Ed25519, compute KeyPackageRef
- Build kind:443 Nostr event: content = base64(TLS-serialized KeyPackage), tags = ['mls_protocol_version', '1'], ['key_package_ref', hex(KeyPackageRef)], ['relays', url1, url2...]
- Parse incoming kind:443 events: decode base64 content, deserialize KeyPackage, validate signature, verify Nostr pubkey matches credential
- Store KeyPackage info (ref, owner pubkey, relays) in storage
- Handle KeyPackage rotation (new KeyPackage replaces old one by pubkey)

Uses: libnostr NostrEvent for event creation, mls_key_package.c for MLS operations.

Reference: marmot/mips/mip00.md, mdk/src/credentials.rs.

title: MIP-01: Implement Group Construction with GroupData extension
description:
Implement MIP-01 — creating MLS groups with the Marmot GroupData extension (0xF2EE).

Operations:
- create_group(): Create MLS group with Marmot extension containing: group name, description, admin pubkeys, relay URLs, optional group image (encrypted with upload key via ChaCha20-Poly1305)
- Add members from their kind:443 KeyPackage events
- Generate Welcome messages for each added member
- Create the initial kind:445 evolution event (commit) announcing group creation
- Admin policy enforcement: only admins can add/remove members, modify group metadata
- Group update: change name/description/admins/relays/image, create commit

The GroupData extension TLS serialization is already implemented in extension.c.

Uses: mls_group.c for MLS group creation, extension.c for GroupData, libnostr for Nostr events.

Reference: marmot/mips/mip01.md, mdk/src/groups.rs.

title: MIP-02: Implement Welcome events with NIP-59 gift-wrapping (kind:444)
description:
Implement MIP-02 — delivering Welcome messages as gift-wrapped Nostr events.

Operations:
- Create welcome rumor: kind:444 unsigned event, content = base64(TLS-serialized MLS Welcome), tags = ['mls_group_id', hex(group_id)]
- Gift-wrap the rumor for each invited member using NIP-59: nostr_nip59_wrap() with the invitee's pubkey
- Process incoming kind:444 events: unwrap via NIP-59, decode Welcome, extract MLS Welcome bytes, pass to MLS Welcome processing
- Welcome preview: extract group metadata (name, description, admin list) from Welcome without fully joining
- Accept/reject welcome: join the MLS group or discard
- Handle welcome expiry (configurable TTL)

Uses: NIP-59 gift-wrapping (nostr_nip59_wrap/unwrap), mls_welcome.c for MLS Welcome processing.

Reference: marmot/mips/mip02.md, mdk/src/welcome.rs.

title: MIP-03: Implement Group Messages with NIP-44 encryption (kind:445)
description:
Implement MIP-03 — sending and receiving encrypted group messages.

Application messages:
- create_message(): Create inner Nostr event (unsigned), encrypt content using NIP-44 with conversation key derived from MLS exporter secret (epoch-specific), wrap in MLS PrivateMessage, serialize as kind:445 event with tags ['mls_group_id', hex(group_id)], ['epoch', epoch_number]
- process_message(): Receive kind:445 event, extract MLS PrivateMessage bytes, decrypt using MLS key schedule, extract inner Nostr event, decrypt content using NIP-44 with exporter secret

Evolution messages (proposals/commits):
- Proposals and commits are kind:445 events with content_type = proposal or commit
- Process incoming commits: update group state, advance epoch
- Handle commit race resolution: snapshot before commit, rollback if own commit conflicts

The exporter secret → NIP-44 conversation key derivation:
- exporter_secret = MLS key_schedule exporter at current epoch
- conversation_key = HKDF-Expand(exporter_secret, 'marmot-nip44-conversation-key', 32)
- Use nostr_nip44_encrypt_v2(conversation_key, plaintext) / nostr_nip44_decrypt_v2(conversation_key, ciphertext)

Handle: own message detection (skip), epoch mismatch (try adjacent epochs), unprocessable messages (too old/future).

Reference: marmot/mips/mip03.md, mdk/src/messages.rs.

title: MIP-03 protocol layer tests
description:
Create comprehensive tests for the MIP-00 through MIP-03 protocol layer.

Tests:
- MIP-00: Create KeyPackage → kind:443 event → parse back → verify round-trip
- MIP-00: Reject invalid KeyPackage events (bad base64, bad sig, wrong kind)
- MIP-01: Create group with 3 members → verify GroupData extension → verify kind:445 evolution event
- MIP-01: Group update (change name) → verify commit event
- MIP-02: Create welcome → gift-wrap → unwrap → preview → accept → verify group membership
- MIP-02: Reject expired welcome

- MIP-03: Epoch transition → old messages still readable (within tolerance)
- MIP-03: Own message detection → MARMOT_MSG_OWN_MESSAGE result
- MIP-03: Commit race → snapshot/rollback/retry
- Full lifecycle: create group → add members → exchange messages → remove member → update → more messages

title: [Epic] Phase 4: Storage Backends & MIP-04
description:
Implement the SQLite storage backend for persistent group state, and the optional MIP-04 encrypted media support.

Deliverables:
1. SQLite storage backend with proper schema, migrations, and encryption support
2. MIP-04: Encrypted media (ChaCha20-Poly1305 with MLS exporter secret keys)
3. Storage contract tests that validate both backends (memory + SQLite)

title: Implement SQLite storage backend (storage_sqlite.c)
description:
Implement a persistent SQLite storage backend implementing the full MarmotStorage vtable.

Schema:
- groups: mls_group_id BLOB PK, nostr_group_id TEXT, name TEXT, description TEXT, admin_pubkeys TEXT (JSON array), relay_urls TEXT (JSON array), state TEXT, epoch INTEGER, created_at INTEGER, updated_at INTEGER
- messages: id TEXT PK, group_id BLOB, sender_pubkey TEXT, content TEXT, kind INTEGER, created_at INTEGER, received_at INTEGER, INDEX(group_id, created_at)
- welcomes: event_id TEXT PK, group_id BLOB, group_name TEXT, sender_pubkey TEXT, status TEXT, received_at INTEGER
- key_packages: ref BLOB PK, owner_pubkey TEXT, relay_urls TEXT, raw BLOB, created_at INTEGER
- mls_kv: key TEXT PK, value BLOB (for MLS group state serialization)
- exporter_secrets: group_id BLOB, epoch INTEGER, secret BLOB, PK(group_id, epoch)
- snapshots: group_id BLOB, name TEXT, state BLOB, created_at INTEGER, PK(group_id, name)

Features:
- WAL mode for concurrent readers
- Optional encryption via sqlcipher (compile-time flag)
- Prepared statements cached for performance
- Transaction batching for bulk operations
- Schema versioning with migration support

File: libmarmot/src/storage_sqlite.c

title: MIP-04: Implement Encrypted Media
description:
Implement MIP-04 — encrypting and decrypting media files for group sharing.

Operations:
- marmot_encrypt_media(): Derive file encryption key from MLS exporter secret at current epoch, generate random nonce, encrypt file data with ChaCha20-Poly1305, create imeta tag with: url (upload destination), m (MIME type), size, dim, x (SHA-256 hash of encrypted bytes), nonce, key_epoch
- marmot_decrypt_media(): Extract epoch from imeta, look up exporter secret, derive file key, decrypt with ChaCha20-Poly1305, verify plaintext hash

Key derivation:
- file_key = HKDF-Expand(exporter_secret[epoch], 'marmot-media-key', 32)
- nonce = random 24 bytes (XChaCha20) or 12 bytes (ChaCha20)

Uses: libsodium crypto_aead_chacha20poly1305_ietf for encryption.

File: libmarmot/src/media.c

title: [Epic] Phase 5: MDK Interop Testing & Validation
description:
Ensure byte-for-byte interoperability with the MDK (Rust reference implementation). This is a mandatory requirement — libmarmot must be able to join groups created by MDK and vice versa.

Deliverables:
1. Capture MDK test vectors for all protocol operations
2. Cross-implementation interop test suite
3. Validation against RFC 9420 Appendix D test vectors

title: Capture MDK test vectors for interop validation
description:
Build and run the MDK test suite, capturing serialized outputs at each stage for use as test vectors in libmarmot.

Vectors to capture:
- KeyPackage serialization (TLS bytes + base64 for kind:443 content)
- KeyPackageRef computation (input bytes + expected hash)
- GroupData extension serialization (various configurations)
- Welcome message serialization (TLS bytes + base64)
- Group message serialization (kind:445 content)
- Exporter secret derivation (epoch + expected secret)
- NIP-44 conversation key derivation from exporter secret
- Complete group lifecycle: create → add member → send messages → remove member

Output format: JSON test vector files in libmarmot/tests/vectors/

Tools: Modify MDK tests to dump intermediate values, or write a dedicated vector generator.

title: Implement cross-implementation interop test suite
description:
Create an interop test suite that validates libmarmot against MDK test vectors.

Tests:
- Parse MDK-generated KeyPackage (kind:443 content) → validate ref, credential, extensions
- Parse MDK-generated Welcome (kind:444 content) → join group → verify group state
- Decrypt MDK-generated group message (kind:445) → verify inner event content
- Generate KeyPackage → feed to MDK → MDK creates group with it → libmarmot processes Welcome
- Round-trip: libmarmot creates group → MDK joins → messages exchanged
- Extension serialization: libmarmot-generated GroupData == MDK-generated GroupData (byte equality)
- TLS serialization: verify struct-by-struct byte equality

The test vectors from nostrc-mm51 are the inputs. Tests must run without a Rust toolchain (pre-captured vectors only).

File: libmarmot/tests/test_interop.c

title: RFC 9420 Appendix D key schedule test vectors
description:
Validate the MLS key schedule implementation against the official RFC 9420 Appendix D test vectors.

The vectors provide known input/output pairs for:
- init_secret → epoch_secret derivation chain
- Individual secret derivations (sender_data_secret, encryption_secret, etc.)
- Per-sender key/nonce derivation at specific generations
- Tree hash computations
- Transcript hash chain

This test must pass with exact byte equality against the RFC vectors. Any mismatch indicates a protocol bug.

File: libmarmot/tests/test_rfc9420_vectors.c
Input: libmarmot/tests/vectors/rfc9420/ (extracted from RFC appendix)

title: marmot-gobject: Core GObject type wrappers
description:
Create GObject wrappers for the core libmarmot types.

Types:
- MarmotGObject (GObject) — wraps Marmot*, manages lifecycle, holds storage reference
  - Properties: config (MarmotConfig boxed), storage (MarmotStorage boxed)
  - Signals: group-created, group-updated, message-received, welcome-received, member-added, member-removed, error
- MarmotGGroup (GObject) — wraps MarmotGroup
  - Properties: group-id, name, description, state (enum), member-count, epoch, created-at
- MarmotGMessage (GObject) — wraps MarmotMessage
  - Properties: id, sender-pubkey, content, kind, group-id, created-at
- MarmotGWelcome (GObject) — wraps MarmotWelcomePreview
  - Properties: event-id, group-name, sender-pubkey, member-count, status (enum)
- MarmotGKeyPackage (GObject) — wraps MarmotKeyPackageInfo
  - Properties: ref (hex string), owner-pubkey, relay-urls (GStrv)
- Boxed types for configs, results, pagination

Directory: marmot-gobject/
Files: src/marmot-gobject-instance.c/h, src/marmot-gobject-group.c/h, etc.

title: marmot-gobject: Async API with GTask
description:
Add async variants of all blocking Marmot operations using GTask.

Async methods:
- marmot_gobject_create_key_package_async/finish
- marmot_gobject_create_group_async/finish
- marmot_gobject_process_welcome_async/finish
- marmot_gobject_accept_welcome_async/finish
- marmot_gobject_create_message_async/finish
- marmot_gobject_process_message_async/finish
- marmot_gobject_encrypt_media_async/finish (if MIP-04 enabled)
- marmot_gobject_decrypt_media_async/finish

Pattern: Each _async method takes GCancellable + GAsyncReadyCallback. Work runs in g_task_run_in_thread. Results via _finish method. Emit appropriate signals on completion (message-received, etc.).

This ensures GTK apps never block the main thread on MLS crypto operations.
